alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 21 at 8:02PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURHTER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...The Kankakee River from near Grundy and Will county line upstream to near Kankakee River State Park, including portions of portions of Grundy and Will counties. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Flooding of roads and streets will continue. Yards and other low-lying areas along the river will remain inundated by water and ice. Shifting ice may damage structures along the shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 756 PM CST, river gauge information and satellite imagery indicate an ongoing significant ice jam located from near the Grundy Will county line upstream to near Wilmington. Flooding will continue near and upstream of the ice jam while it remains in place. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wilmington and Lakewood Shores. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Warning means flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers, creeks, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property.
